awd_titl_txt: Integration of Computer Enhanced Instruction in the         Mathematics Curriculum
awd_abstract_narration: The Division of Mathematics is initiating a mathematics                         laboratory for use by students taking algebra and calculus                      courses.  This project permits the mathematics faculty to                       incorporate new and existing computer software into the                         curriculum of college algebra, trigonometry, calculus I, II,                    and III.  The project provides 15 microcomputers, six printers,                 and Derive software for use by mathematics faculty in addition                  to software provided by textbook publishers.  Derive                            intelligently applies the rules of algebra, trigonometry,                       calculus, and matrix algebra to solve a wide range of                           mathematical problems.  Powerful capabilities exist for both                    two-dimensional (Cartesian, polar, and parametric) and three-                   dimensional graphing.
